description:
Vitrella brassicaformis CCMP3155 is a species of microalgae that belongs to the Chlorophyta phylum, specifically the class Trebouxiophyceae. It is a unicellular, green microalgae that was isolated from a soil sample collected in Liangping, China.

Vitrella brassicaformis CCMP3155 has a spherical to ovoid cell shape, with a diameter typically ranging from 5 to 10 micrometers. The cells possess a single chloroplast, which is cup-shaped and contains pyrenoids, structures involved in carbon dioxide fixation and starch storage.

This microalgal species is known to have a relatively fast growth rate and can be cultivated under various environmental conditions, such as different light intensities and nutrient concentrations. Vitrella brassicaformis CCMP3155 has potential applications in the fields of biofuel production, wastewater treatment, and the synthesis of valuable metabolites, such as lipids and pigments.
